As you approach the spot where the demon dissipated, you can see that there are some remains left behind. Upon closer inspection, you notice that there are a few small, black stones scattered around the area.

You recognize these stones as demon-soul shards, a powerful and rare magical ingredient. They are formed when a demon is destroyed and its energy is released. These shards are highly sought after by many practitioners of dark magic, as they can be used in spells to increase power and control.

You carefully collect the shards, knowing that they could be useful in your future battles against the supernatural. As you do so, you notice that there is also a small piece of paper lying nearby.

You pick it up and unfold it, revealing a cryptic message scrawled in red ink. It reads, "The master has plans for the city. You cannot stop us all."

You can feel a chill run down your spine as you realize that this is a message from the vampire gang you were investigating. It seems that they are up to something big, and you will need to be even more vigilant in your efforts to protect the city.

You tuck the paper into your pocket and head back to your apartment, already planning your next move. You know that the fight against the supernatural never truly ends, but you're ready for whatever comes next.

I ruminate on whether or not the vampires being more active has to do with this "master" referenced in the note. Clearly the master caused my spell to fail with the demon allowing him to escape. I decide that I need to talk to someone a little higher on the food chain to figure out what's going on. I need Bob.

As you ponder the cryptic message on the paper and the increased activity of the local vampire gang, you know that you need to get to the bottom of this as soon as possible. And that means you need the expertise of Bob, your trusty spirit companion.

You make your way back to your apartment and call out to Bob, who appears before you in a cloud of blue smoke.

"Harry, my man, what can I do for you?" Bob asks, his ghostly form floating in front of you.

"Bob, I need your help. I think the vampire gang in the city might be up to something big, and there's a master involved," you explain.

Bob's eyes widen in surprise. "A master? That's serious business, Harry. We're talking major-league vampire politics here."

"I know," you say. "That's why I need your help. Can you give me any information about this master, or what the vampires might be planning?"

Bob nods thoughtfully. "I might have a few leads. Let me do some research and see what I can come up with. Meanwhile, you need to stay on your guard. If the vampires are up to something big, you can bet that they'll be targeting you."

You nod in agreement, knowing that Bob is right. You thank him for his help and watch as he disappears into his skull-shaped container.

You know that the road ahead will be dangerous, but with Bob's expertise and your own magic, you're ready to face whatever comes your way.
What other friends could I ask help from?

As a powerful wizard and protector of Chicago, you have a network of allies and friends who can help you in times of need. In addition to Bob, there are several other people you can turn to for assistance.

One potential ally is Karrin Murphy, a detective with the Chicago Police Department who often works with you on cases involving the supernatural. Murphy is tough, resourceful, and has a keen eye for detail, making her a valuable asset in any investigation.

Another friend you could turn to is Michael Carpenter, a Knight of the Cross and a devout Christian who uses his faith and swordsmanship to fight against evil. Michael has helped you on several occasions in the past, and his knowledge of the supernatural could be invaluable in your current situation.

You could also reach out to Thomas Raith, a member of the White Court vampire family and one of your closest allies. Although Thomas struggles with his own inner demons, he has proven to be a loyal friend and a powerful ally in battles against the supernatural.

Finally, you could always seek the guidance of the White Council of Wizards, a governing body of wizards who oversee and regulate the use of magic. Although the Council can be strict and rigid, they have vast knowledge and resources that could be useful in your investigation.

Ultimately, the choice of who to turn to for help will depend on the specifics of your situation and the resources you need. But with your powerful friends and allies at your side, you know that you can overcome any challenge that comes your way.

I think Michael and Thomas could help me the most, I send them messages to meet me at the local crypt (they know the place well and it's protected from many types of magic) and head over to meet them at 3pm prompt.

As you make your way to the crypt, you send messages to both Michael and Thomas, asking them to meet you there at 3pm sharp. You know that the crypt is a secure and protected location, making it an ideal place to discuss sensitive matters related to the supernatural.

As you approach the crypt, you see Michael and Thomas waiting for you outside. Michael nods in greeting, his sword at his side, while Thomas gives you a wry smile.

"What's the situation, Harry?" Michael asks, his voice serious.

"I think the local vampire gang might be up to something big," you explain, filling them in on the details of your recent encounter with the demon and the cryptic message on the piece of paper.

Thomas frowns, his brow furrowed in concern. "A master vampire? That's bad news, Harry. Those guys don't mess around."

"I know," you say grimly. "That's why I need your help. We need to figure out what the vampires are planning and put a stop to it before it's too late."

Michael nods in agreement. "I'll do whatever I can to help, Harry. You know that."

Thomas nods as well. "Count me in. But we need more information before we can take any action. We need to find out who this master vampire is, and what he wants."

You all agree that the first step is to gather more information. You decide to split up and investigate different parts of the city, looking for any clues that might lead you to the vampire master. You make plans to reconvene at the crypt in 24 hours to share what you've learned and come up with a plan of action.

As you part ways with Michael and Thomas, you know that the road ahead will be difficult and dangerous. But with your friends at your side, you're ready to face whatever comes your way.
But first I need a cold drink, it was a busy morning killing demons, and there might be useful information from the bar keep.

You make your way to a nearby bar and order a cold drink. As you take a sip, you ask the barkeep if he's heard anything about the local vampire gang.

The barkeep looks at you warily. "I don't know nothing about no vampires," he says, his voice low.

You give him a reassuring smile. "I'm not here to cause any trouble, I just need some information. Have you seen any suspicious activity in the area lately?"

The barkeep hesitates for a moment before nodding. "There's been some strange things going on around here lately," he admits. "People disappearing, strange noises at night. I don't know if it's vampires or what, but it ain't normal."

You thank the barkeep for the information and finish your drink. As you leave the bar, you can't help but feel a sense of unease. The situation is more serious than you thought, and you'll need all the help you can get to stop the master vampire and his minions.
Maybe my werewolf friends will have an idea about the local gangs, they keep to the streets. I head over to see what they are up too.

You decide to pay a visit to your werewolf friends, hoping that they might have some insights into the activities of the local vampire gangs. You know that they tend to keep an eye on the streets and have connections with other supernatural creatures.

As you arrive at the werewolf's territory, you're greeted by the alpha, a powerful werewolf named Marcone. He eyes you warily, but nods in greeting when he recognizes you.

"What brings you here, Dresden?" Marcone asks, his voice low and rumbling.

"I need your help," you explain, filling him in on the situation with the vampires and the master vampire. "I was hoping you might know something about the local gangs and their activities."

Marcone considers for a moment, then nods. "We've heard some rumors about a new gang in town," he says. "They've been making a lot of noise lately, trying to muscle in on our territory. We think they might be connected to the vampires."

"Do you know anything else about them?" you ask.

Marcone shakes his head. "Not much, I'm afraid. But we'll keep an ear to the ground and let you know if we hear anything else."

You thank Marcone for his help and make your way back to the crypt, mulling over what you've learned. It's clear that the situation is getting more dangerous by the minute, and you'll need to act quickly if you want to stop the master vampire and his minions before it's too late.
